page.title: 09TRANSPORT
page.content:
There are two mainline railway tracks running through this section of the map. The more southerly of the two lines runs between Tilbury and Shoeburyness. The other is the main commuter line between Fenchurch Street in London and southend-on-Sea. It picks up the southern line in Pitsea.
Much of the land on both lines is banked or cut, enabling the train to run above or below ground level, thereby ensuring the minimum disturbance to the people of Bsildon. When the New Town was first built, it was not served by a Railway Station. People had to travel to Laindon Station, or Pitsea if they wanted to travel by train. Basildon station was opened in 1972.
